question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: increase_supply_balance()] [Rounding Error Exploitation] ray_div(amount, supply_index) at line 329 - can attacker exploit rounding to receive more scaled_amount than deserved? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: increase_supply_balance()] [Supply Index Zero] If supply_index is 0 or extremely small, ray_div will panic or produce massive scaled_amount - can this be exploited? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: decrease_supply_balance()] [Insufficient Balance Check] No check if user has sufficient balance before decrease - can attacker trigger underflow in storage module? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: decrease_supply_balance()] [Scaled Amount Precision] Using same ray_div as increase - can rounding differences cause imbalance between deposits and withdrawals? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: increase_borrow_balance()] [Borrow Index Manipulation] ray_div(amount, borrow_index) at line 343 - can attacker borrow when borrow_index is artificially low to get more scaled_amount? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: decrease_borrow_balance()] [Repayment Rounding] Rounding in ray_div may cause user to repay slightly less than actual debt - can this accumulate over time? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: decrease_borrow_balance()] [Negative Balance Risk] No explicit check for sufficient borrow balance - can decrease cause underflow? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: is_health()] [Health Factor Threshold] health_factor >= ray() check - can attacker exploit boundary condition where health_factor equals exactly ray()? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: is_health()] [Oracle Staleness] No staleness check on oracle prices - can attacker exploit stale oracle data to appear healthy when actually unhealthy? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: user_health_factor()] [Division by Zero] If health_loan_value is 0, returns address::max() - can attacker manipulate loan value to 0 to avoid liquidation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: user_health_factor()] [Ray Math Precision] Nested ray_div and ray_mul operations - can accumulated rounding errors cause incorrect health factor? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: user_health_factor()] [Collateral Value Manipulation] health_collateral_value calculated from oracle - can attacker manipulate oracle to inflate health factor? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: user_health_factor()] [Liquidation Threshold Manipulation] dynamic_liquidation_threshold used in calculation - can attacker exploit threshold calculation to avoid liquidation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: user_health_factor_batch()] [Gas Limit DoS] Loops through all users in vector - can attacker provide massive user list to cause out-of-gas? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: dynamic_liquidation_threshold()] [Division by Zero] If collateral_value is 0, function returns 0 - can this cause unexpected behavior in health factor calculations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/logic.move] [Function: dynamic_liquidation_threshold()] [Collateral Weight Manipulation] Threshold weighted by collateral value - can attacker deposit low-threshold assets to lower overall threshold? (High)
